biolockj.module.seq

Class SeqFileValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • biolockj.module.BioModuleImpl
      • biolockj.module.ScriptModuleImpl
        • biolockj.module.JavaModuleImpl
          • biolockj.module.seq.SeqFileValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BioModule, JavaModule, ScriptModule, SeqModule, Comparable<BioModule>

    public class SeqFileValidator
extends JavaModuleImpl
implements JavaModule, SeqModule
    This BioModule validates fasta/fastq file formats are valid and enforces min/max read lengths.
    GUI Module Name
    Sequence File Validator

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static String INPUT_SEQ_MAX
      Config Integer property "seqFileValidator.seqMaxLen" defines the maximum number of bases per read
      protected static String INPUT_SEQ_MIN
      Config Integer property "seqFileValidator.seqMinLen" defines the minimum number of bases per read
      static String NUM_VALID_READS
      Column name that holds number of valid reads per sample: "Num_Valid_Reads"
      protected static String REQUIRE_EUQL_NUM_PAIRS
      Config Boolean property "seqFileValidator.requireEqualNumPairs" determines if module requires equal number of forward and reverse reads (simple check).

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cleanUp()
      Set "Num_Valid_Reads" as the number of reads field.
      List<File> getSeqFiles(Collection<File> files)
      Return only sequence files for sample IDs found in the metadata file.
      If Config."metadata.required" = "Y", an error is thrown to list the files that cannot be matched to a metadata row.
      String getSummary()
      Produce a summary message with counts on total number of reads and number of valid reads containing a barcode defined in the metadata file.
      protected void removeBadFiles()
      Remove sequence files in which all reads failed validation checks, leaving only an empty file.
      void runModule()
      Cache sampleIds to compare to validated sampleIds post-processing.
      protected void validateFile(File file, Integer fileCount)
      Validate sequence files: Validate valid 1st sequence header character is expected character Validate fastq files have same number of bases and quality scores per read Remove reads below minimum threshold: "seqFileValidator.seqMinLen" Trim reads if above the maximum threshold: "seqFileValidator.seqMaxLen" Invalid reads are saved to a file in the module temp directory for analysis/review.
      protected void verifyPairedSeqs()
      Verify equal number of forward and reverse read files.
      if "seqFileValidator.requireEqualNumPairs"="Y", verify forward and reverse read files have an equal number of reads.

      • getSeqFiles

        public List<File> getSeqFiles(Collection<File> files)
                       throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: SeqModule
        Return only sequence files for sample IDs found in the metadata file.
        If Config."metadata.required" = "Y", an error is thrown to list the files that cannot be matched to a metadata row.
        Specified by:
        getSeqFiles in interface SeqModule
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Module sequence files
        Throws:
        Exception - if no input files are found

      • runModule

        public void runModule()
               throws Exception
        Cache sampleIds to compare to validated sampleIds post-processing. Call validateFile(File, Integer) for each input file.
        Call removeBadFiles() to remove empty files (cases where all reads fail validation).
        Call verifyPairedSeqs() if module input files are paired read files.
        Call MetaUtil.addColumn(String, Map, File, boolean)
        Specified by:
        runModule in interface JavaModule
        Specified by:
        runModule in class JavaModuleImpl
        Throws:
        Exception - thrown if any runtime error occurs

      • removeBadFiles

        protected void removeBadFiles()
                       throws Exception
        Remove sequence files in which all reads failed validation checks, leaving only an empty file.
        Throws:
        Exception - if errors occur

      • validateFile

        protected void validateFile(File file,
                            Integer fileCount)
                     throws Exception
        Validate sequence files:
        1. Validate valid 1st sequence header character is expected character
        2. Validate fastq files have same number of bases and quality scores per read
        3. Remove reads below minimum threshold: "seqFileValidator.seqMinLen"
        4. Trim reads if above the maximum threshold: "seqFileValidator.seqMaxLen"
        Invalid reads are saved to a file in the module temp directory for analysis/review.
        Parameters:
        file - Sequence file
        fileCount - Integer count
        Throws:
        Exception - if I/O errors occur while processing sequence files

      • verifyPairedSeqs

        protected void verifyPairedSeqs()
                         throws Exception
        Verify equal number of forward and reverse read files.
        if "seqFileValidator.requireEqualNumPairs"="Y", verify forward and reverse read files have an equal number of reads.
        Throws:
        Exception - if validations fail or errors occur
